001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util;
002
003import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
004import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Quaternion;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Rotation;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
012
013import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
014
015/**
016 * Utility math methods used for camera calibration.
017 *
018 * @author WB
019 * @version 2022/12/19
020 */
021public abstract class MathUtil {
022
023        private MathUtil() {}
024
025        public static double[] toArray(Point2D p) {
026                return new double[] {p.getX(), p.getY()};
027        }
028        
029        public static Point2D.Double toPoint2D(double[] xy) {
030                return new Point2D.Double(xy[0], xy[1]);
031        }
032        
033        public static RealVector crossProduct3x3(RealVector A, RealVector B) {
034                final double[] a = A.toArray();
035                final double[] b = B.toArray();
036                final double[] c = {
037                                a[1] * b[2] - b[1] * a[2],
038                                a[2] * b[0] - b[2] * a[0],
039                                a[0] * b[1] - b[0] * a[1]
040                };
041                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(c);
042        }
043        
044        public static RealVector getRowPackedVector(RealMatrix A) {
045                double[][] AA = A.getData();
046                double[] V = new double[AA.length * AA[0].length];
047                int k = 0;
048                for (int i = 0; i < AA.length; i++) {
049                        for (int j = 0; j < AA[0].length; j++) {
050                                V[k++] = AA[i][j];
051                        }
052                }
053                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(V);
054        }
055        
056        public static RealMatrix fromRowPackedVector(RealVector V, int rows, int columns) {
057                double[][] AA = new double[rows][columns];
058                double[] data = V.toArray();
059                int k = 0;
060                for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
061                        for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) {
062                                AA[i][j] = data[k++];
063                        }
064                }
065                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(AA);
066        }
067
068        /**
069         * Finds a nontrivial solution (x) to the homogeneous linear system A . x = 0 by singular-value decomposition. If A
070         * has more rows than columns, the system of equations is overdetermined. In this case the returned solution
071         * minimizes the residual ||A . x|| in the least-squares sense.
072         *
073         * @param A the original matrix.
074         * @return the solution vector x.
075         */
076        public static RealVector solveHomogeneousSystem(RealMatrix A) {
077                // TODO: needs to be validated!!
078                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(A);
079                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
080                // RealVector x = V.getColumnVector(V.getColumnDimension() - 1);
081                // return x;
082                int minIdx = Matrix.idxMin(svd.getSingularValues());
083                return V.getColumnVector(minIdx);
084        }
085
086        /**
087         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous vector by attaching an additional 1-element. The
088         * resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the specified Cartesian vector. See also
089         * {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
090         *
091         * @param ac a Cartesian vector
092         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
093         */
094        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] ac) {
095                double[] xh = new double[ac.length + 1];
096                for (int i = 0; i < ac.length; i++) {
097                        xh[i] = ac[i];
098                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
099                }
100                return xh;
101        }
102
103
104        /**
105         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian vector, which is one element shorter. See also
106         * {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
107         *
108         * @param ah a homogeneous vector
109         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
110         * @throws DivideByZeroException if the last vector element is zero
111         */
112        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] ah) throws DivideByZeroException {
113                double[] xc = new double[ah.length - 1];
114                final double s = 1 / ah[ah.length - 1];
115                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
116                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
117                for (int i = 0; i < ah.length - 1; i++) {
118                        xc[i] = s * ah[i];
119                }
120                return xc;
121        }
122        
123        public static double mean(double[] x) {
124                final int n = x.length;
125                if (n == 0) 
126                        return 0;
127                double sum = 0;
128                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
129                        sum = sum + x[i];
130                }
131                return sum / n;
132        }
133        
134        /**
135         * Returns the variance of the specified values.
136         * @param x a sequence of real values 
137         * @return the variance of the values in x (sigma^2)
138         */
139        public static double variance(double[] x) {
140                final int n = x.length;
141                if (n == 0) 
142                        return 0;
143                double sum = 0;
144                double sum2 = 0;
145                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
146                        sum = sum + x[i];
147                        sum2 = sum2 + x[i] * x[i];
148                }
149                return (sum2 - (sum * sum) / n) / n;
150        }
151        
152        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
153
154        /**
155         * Converts a {@link Rotation} to a {@link Quaternion}.
156         * @param R a rotation
157         * @return the corresponding quaternion
158         */
159        public static Quaternion toQuaternion(Rotation R) {
160                return new Quaternion(R.getQ0(), R.getQ1(), R.getQ2(), R.getQ3());
161        }
162
163        /**
164         * Converts a {@link Quaternion} to a {@link Rotation}.
165         * @param q a quaternion
166         * @return the associated rotation
167         */
168        public static Rotation toRotation(Quaternion q) {
169                return new Rotation(q.getQ0(), q.getQ1(), q.getQ2(), q.getQ3(), true);
170        }
171
172    /**
173     * Linearly interpolate two 3D {@link Rotation} instances.
174     * @param R0 first rotation
175     * @param R1 second rotation
176     * @param alpha the blending factor in [0,1]
177     * @return the interpolated rotation
178     */
179    public static Rotation Lerp(Rotation R0, Rotation R1, double alpha) {
180        Quaternion qa = toQuaternion(R0);
181        Quaternion qb = toQuaternion(R1);
182        return toRotation(Lerp(qa, qb, alpha));
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Linearly interpolate two {@link Quaternion} instances.
187     * @param Q0 first quaternion
188     * @param Q1 second quaternion
189     * @param alpha the blending factor in [0,1]
190     * @return the interpolated quaternion
191     */
192    public static Quaternion Lerp(Quaternion Q0, Quaternion Q1, double alpha) {
193        return Quaternion.add(Q0.multiply(1 - alpha), Q1.multiply(alpha));
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Linearly interpolate two 3D translation vectors.
198     * @param t0 first translation vector
199     * @param t1 second translation vector
200     * @param alpha the blending factor in [0,1]
201     * @return the interpolated translation vector
202     */
203    public static double[] Lerp(double[] t0, double[] t1, double alpha) {
204        double[] t01 = t0.clone();
205        for (int i = 0; i < t01.length; i++) {
206            t01[i] = (1 - alpha) * t0[i] + alpha * t1[i];
207        }
208        return t01;
209    }
210
211        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
212
213        /**
214         * Calculates the 'inverse condition number' (RCOND() in Matlab)
215         * of the given matrix (0,...,1, ideally close to 1).
216         * @param A the matrix
217         * @return the inverse condition number
218         */
219        public static double inverseConditionNumber(double[][] A) {
220                RealMatrix M = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A);
221                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(M);
222                return svd.getInverseConditionNumber();
223        }
224
225
226    // ---------------------------------------------------------------
227

241        // }
242}
